website_summaries.verdict: This mountain bike brake offers smooth operation, mudguard, and a long lifespan.
pros: Comes with a 90° noodle and rubber boot
Enables you to instantly lock up a mountain bike's rear wheel
Equipped with adjustment screws so brake won't rub against wheel

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for standard brakes that came with big store bike
customer_reviews.text: I have a box store bought bike, the schwinn trailway 700cc size,from a couple years ago. Whenever I went to adjust the brakes, the little screw that is supposed to adjust the springs tension did not seem to do anything at all. I finally gave up and bought this to replace it.... Works like a charm now! When I tighten/loosen the screws, they actually affect the springs! Took about 15 minutes to take the old off and put this one on, rear tire. Thinking about getting the front set next!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan White

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Sweet upgrade from the OG 1990's straight pull that were on the bike. One thing to consider if you're changing the setup; the cable needs to stick out of the side. The way it came it would have rubbed my leg. I modified the metal sleeve a little to change the angle. I'm really happy with it. These are much easier to adjust. Another review said it did not have an Allen screw on the adjuster. It's there, but for some reason it's threaded like a nut so it doesn't look like an Allen would fit, but it does.
customer_reviews.author: TeddyZ

customer_reviews.title: Stops on a dime!
customer_reviews.text: I used a pair of these to upgrade a mountain bike using the old style cantilever brakes. Installation is a snap. I would strongly advise using new brake cables if you're changing out what's on the bike to these. The braking action would probably be as smooth as silk that way. Proper adjustment is simple. There is one small screw on each brake arm. Tighten one and loosen the other (1/2 turn at a time) until they both pull and release equally. These V-brakes come with pads already installed so you don't have to order new ones. At the price, they can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: RichardCTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: They install quite simply and easily and work so much better that the old cantilever brakes that they replaced! I've been spending about $10 a year replacing the brake shoes on the front of my bike, not to mention how difficult it is to adjust the new pads to work evenly and not squeal, for only $5 more you get a far better brake system that is a breeze to adjust the pads! The kit comes with everything you'll need (yes, it comes with the "noodle" and boot) and interfaced with my original brake cable and brake levers just fine. You will be happy with the quiet and strong braking after it's been installed!
customer_reviews.author: L R Snyder

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for the money
customer_reviews.text: They were easy to install, they work as well as I hoped, and they look great. The pads that come with it aren't the best and that's why I'm take a star off. The material is fine but they are really wide so it's hard to get them perfectly on the brake section of the rim on a 700c wheel. Comes with a noodle, rubber boot, brake, and black brake boss screws. I have a black bike that had silver brake boss screws so that was a win-win.
customer_reviews.author: leather feathers

customer_reviews.title: I hate to have to squeeze hand to brake and these ...
customer_reviews.text: The ease of use of these relatively inexpensive brakes makes them worthwhile to install. These make the biking a lot more enjoyable for me. I hate to have to squeeze hand to brake and these are much more sensitive to pressure than most others. Shimano makes slightly better brakes for a little more money, e.g. the Deore v brakes. I have bought and installed more of these than any other. The super brakes of the recent past was the Avid serial 7 v brake, that you can still get on eBay for $60.00 a front and rear set!
customer_reviews.author: John C. Bendheim, M.D.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: The Upgrade I Needed
customer_reviews.text: My bike came with low profile Pro Max brakes, but they weren't very good about fine adjustments (the hex screws all stripped almost immediately) and the low profile became a problem when I added fenders. These Shimano brakes had better stopping power, are easier to fine tune (phillips screw for adjustments), and give proper clearance over my fenders. Down sides are that they don't look as cool as the low profile ones did and they also don't fit flush with my bike frame. Not certain if that's Shimano's fault or my frame-maker's, but doesn't seem to impact performance, purely aesthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Cynfelyn

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement brake on cheap Walmart MTB
customer_reviews.text: My sister's neighbor gave her an old MTB from Walmart so I fixed it up for her by replacing all the rubber, including the brake pads. Even with new pads, the rear brake just didn't work well. I bought this brake to replace the original junk brake. Even though it is listed as a front brake, it works fine on the rear and included new pads which are much better quality than the replacements I had put on the old brakes. I simply had to reverse the pads to be in the proper orientation. Great value on this brake.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: My son's bike original rear brake hardware had a spring break on it where no amount of adjustments would make the thing work without slowing him down, which he hated. This replacement brake assembly was the perfect fix. It was easily installed and easily adjusted to operate exactly like it should operate. Unlike the old brake, this one doesn't rub the tire or wheel at all and grips the wheel well for fast stops. Will buy this replacement kit if ever in need of replacing another.

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Kid's Bike
customer_reviews.text: Fits my son's Brand: Marin, Model: Hidden Canyon bike. The instructions that came with the brakes leaves something to be desired. I almost decided to take it to a bike shop the next day and have them install it. Fortunately, I went to this YouTube video: [...] "Installing V Brakes on a bicycle" by Spadout.com. Except for his advice to use grease on the screw (~2:10, don't do it as it will negate the lock-tite seen as a white paint that is already on the Shimano supplied screw threads) it was very informative and allowed me to install the brakes without a hitch.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Trek Navigator perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement for my OEM Promax v-brake. Good springs, well made and easy to install. One minor complaint - The cable lock assembly isn't made with any cuts or groves to hold the cable while tightening. So you have to tighten down a flat washer while holding the cable in place and compressing the v-break. It's a bit annoying to fine tune the cable length without a 3rd hand. The Promax had a groove in the assembly that cradled the cable while making final adjustments - no 3rd hand needed.
